column4: hi im trying to umount my cdrom drive but it keeps telling me that it is busy but i dont have the prog loaded which is on the cd
hi im trying to umount my cdrom drive but it keeps telling me that it is busy but i dont have the prog loaded which is on the cd
no
no
hi im trying to umount my cdrom drive but it keeps telling me that it is busy but i dont have the prog loaded which is on the cd
you've got a process that accesses the CD still. Usually, that's a shell with a path on the CD as its working directory.
i dont think that can be since i deleated the directory associated to the cd
you can't delete a directory on CD
no i meant i deleated the program from the cd which was installed on my harddrive
that doesn't matter. If you can't unmount the CD, it's because a process is accessing the CD still. It could be a shell, or perhaps a nautilus (file browser) window
how can i find out which process that is without rebooting?
do you know the device name of your CD drive?
no, it starts with /dev/
type 'mount' to find out what it is
ah its called /dev/hdc
okay. 'lsof | grep /dev/hdc' to find out what's blocking it.
well two things turnd out but what am i looking for exactly?
is one of them bash?
yes should i kill the pid?
you could, or just find the shell and run 'cd' in it.
dunno how to find a shell sry :)
it's probably running in a terminal window.
only have the one open with which im trying to should it down.... but as it seems that was the one so thanks allot
